bibl.title: How Do You Want Your Goddess? From the Galjub Hoard to a General Vision on Religious Choice in Hellenistic and Roman Egypt.
bibl.note: The Galjub Hoard [small bronzes, found around 1912-1913] and other Ensembles. - Acculturation. - Repertoire. - Choice. - The Nature of Hellenistic Egypt - As Reflected in Its Religious Life.

bibl.title: Isis on the Nile. Egyptian Gods in Hellenistic and Roman Egypt. Proceedings of the IVth International Conference of Isis Studies, Liège, November 27-29, 2008. Michel Malaise in honorem

bibl.seg: NAEREBOUT Frederick G., How Do You Want Your Goddess? From the Galjub Hoard to a General Vision on Religious Choice in Hellenistic and Roman Egypt.

Laurent BRICAULT and Miguel John VERSLUYS (Edd.), Isis on the Nile. Egyptian Gods in Hellenistic and Roman Egypt. Proceedings of the IVth International Conference of Isis Studies, Liège, November 27-29, 2008. Michel Malaise in honorem = Religions in the Graeco-Roman World. 171 (Leiden, 2010) pp. 55-73.
The Galjub Hoard [small bronzes, found around 1912-1913] and other Ensembles. - Acculturation. - Repertoire. - Choice. - The Nature of Hellenistic Egypt - As Reflected in Its Religious Life.
